"Memory CD4' Th2 cells are a subset of CD4' T cells that have previously encountered antigen and are involved in promoting Th2-type immune responses, including allergy and asthma."

"T-bet is a lineage-defining transcription factor that regulates Th1 cell differentiation and IFN-γ production in CD4-positive T cells."<SEP>"T-bet is a novel transcription factor that directs TH1 lineage commitment, as described in the 2000 study."<SEP>"T-bet is a transcription factor associated with Th1 differentiation in CD4 T cells, and its expression is measured in NP-specific CD4 T cells to assess their phenotype after HDM exposure."<SEP>"T-bet is a transcription factor associated with Th1 immunity, showing maximal induction at day 8 post influenza infection."<SEP>"T-bet is a transcription factor detected by antibody staining, relevant to immune cell characterization in the study."<SEP>"T-bet is a transcription factor expressed in CD4+ T cells, associated with Th1 differentiation and antiviral responses, and its expression is modulated by allergen and cytokine exposure."<SEP>"T-bet is a transcription factor expressed in CD4+ T cells, regulating their phenotype and function, with its expression modulated by cytokines such as IL-33 and IL-18."<SEP>"T-bet is a transcription factor expressed in NP-specific CD4+ T cells, associated with Th1 differentiation and cytokine production, whose levels are modulated by infection and allergen exposure."<SEP>"T-bet is a transcription factor expressed in T cells, particularly CD4+ T cells. It regulates the differentiation and function of these cells, influencing their response to infection and inflammation."<SEP>"T-bet is a transcription factor necessary for IFN-\(\gamma\) production in CD4+ T cells, with its expression level modulated by prior infection and allergen exposure."

"GATA-3 is a transcription factor associated with Th2 cell differentiation and function, used as a marker to assess Th2 fate in CD4 T cells."<SEP>"GATA-3 is a transcription factor that defines Th2 lineage in CD4-positive T cells, highly expressed after HDM exposure."

"Foxp3 is a transcription factor detected by antibody staining, relevant to immune cell characterization in the study."<SEP>"Foxp3 is a transcription factor expressed by regulatory CD4 T cells, used as a marker to assess the regulatory potential of NP-specific CD4 T cells in the lung after allergen challenge."<SEP>"Foxp3 is a transcription factor that defines regulatory T cells (Tregs), measured to assess regulatory T cell frequency and function."
"NP-specific CD4 T cells are a subset of memory T cells in mice that recognize influenza nucleoprotein (NP) and reside in the lung, studied for their response to allergen and viral challenges."
"Der 1 is an allergen protein from HDM, used to identify Der 1-specific CD4 T cells in experimental flow cytometry assays."
"Red5; IL-5 tdTomato is a reporter construct in mice that allows detection of IL-5 protein expression, used to study cytokine production by CD4 T cells."
"IFN-γ transcriptional reporter is a genetic construct in mice enabling visualization of IFN-γ production by CD4 T cells during immune responses."

"NP31-32-31-A–specific CD4 T cells are a subset of NP-specific CD4 T cells identified by tetramer staining, used to study antigen specificity and activation in response to infection and allergen challenge."
"DP 1-xyz-2A–specific CD4 T cells are another subset of antigen-specific CD4 T cells used in experiments to assess cross-reactivity and activation."
"CD4 T\({}_{\text{RM}}\) are tissue-resident memory CD4 T cells found in the lung, characterized by their persistence and role in local immune responses after infection and allergen exposure."
"Regulatory CD4 T cells are a subset of CD4 T cells expressing Foxp3, involved in suppressing immune responses and maintaining tolerance."

"IL-10 is a Th2 cytokine secreted by splenocytes, known for its anti-inflammatory properties."<SEP>"IL-10 is a cytokine produced by regulatory T cells, measured in NP-specific CD4+ T cells to assess immune regulation after infection and allergen exposure."<SEP>"IL-10 is an anti-inflammatory cytokine produced by CD4+ T cells, with decreased production in SAA3(-/-) mice."<SEP>"IL-10 is an anti-inflammatory cytokine produced by CD4+ T cells, with reduced production observed in HDM-exposed NP-specific CD4+ T cells upon reactivation."<SEP>"IL-10 is an anti-inflammatory cytokine produced by T cells, with decreased production observed in NP-specific CD4+ T cells after allergic sensitization and challenge."<SEP>"IL-10 is an anti-inflammatory cytokine produced by regulatory and other CD4 T cells, assessed for its production by NP-specific CD4 T cells after allergen exposure."
"Thy.2 label is a marker used to distinguish lung parenchymal cells from those in circulation during flow cytometry analysis."
"Der 110-xyz-1A-A tetramer is a reagent used to identify Der 1-specific CD4 T cells in flow cytometry assays."
"NP31-32-1-A-A tetramer is a reagent used to identify NP-specific CD4 T cells in flow cytometry assays."

"NP-specific CD4+ T cells are a subset of T cells in mice that recognize the nucleoprotein (NP) of influenza virus, studied for their cytokine production and memory responses in the lung."<SEP>"NP-specific CD4+ T cells are a subset of T cells in the lung that recognize nucleoprotein (NP) from influenza virus, playing a key role in immune memory and response to infection and allergen exposure."
"Th1 T cells are a lineage of CD4+ T cells characterized by the production of IFN-γ and expression of T-bet, involved in cellular immunity against intracellular pathogens."
"Th2 T cells are a lineage of CD4+ T cells characterized by the production of cytokines such as IL-5 and IL-13, involved in humoral immunity and allergic responses."
"Regulatory T cells are a lineage of CD4+ T cells involved in immune regulation, characterized by the production of cytokines such as IL-10."
"SIPR1 (Sphingosine-1-phosphate receptor 1) is a receptor involved in T cell migration, targeted by FTY720 to prevent T cell entry into peripheral tissues."
"Memory T cells are a subset of CD4+ T cells that persist after infection, capable of rapid response upon re-exposure to antigen, and are studied for their cytokine production and phenotype."
